outbound.total_estimated_price: $1400 - $2400+ (for 4 travelers, based on a major US origin during Thanksgiving week)

flights.notes: Prices are estimates for a major US origin (e.g., Chicago, Dallas, Atlanta). For 4 travelers during the busy Thanksgiving week, flight prices can be very high. Booking well in advance (6-9 months) is crucial for better rates. Consider flying into Newark (EWR) or LaGuardia (LGA) as alternatives to JFK, sometimes offering different price points.

carRental.type_of_car: Mid-size SUV (e.g., Toyota RAV4, Honda CR-V) or Full-size Sedan (e.g., Toyota Camry, Nissan Altima)
carRental.daily_rate: $80 - $150+ (highly dependent on demand during Thanksgiving week and pickup location)
carRental.recommendation: A car rental is generally NOT recommended for staying within Manhattan or most of New York City due to heavy traffic, expensive parking ($50-80+ per day), and excellent public transportation. If you plan extensive day trips outside the city (e.g., Upstate NY, Hamptons), consider renting for just those specific days and picking up/dropping off at one of the airport locations (JFK, LGA, EWR) to avoid city surcharges.

options: MTA Subway and Bus System (covers all five boroughs)
Long Island Rail Road (LIRR) for Queens/Long Island
PATH Train for New Jersey (including Newark Airport)
public_transit.payment: OMNY (tap-to-pay with credit/debit card or mobile wallet) or MetroCard (can be purchased at stations and refilled). A 7-day unlimited MetroCard is often cost-effective for frequent use ($34 as of late 2024).
public_transit.recommendation: Highly recommended for getting around NYC efficiently and affordably. Most major attractions are easily accessible via subway.

ride_sharing.notes: Widely available throughout NYC. Can be convenient for late nights, specific routes not well-covered by subway, or when traveling with luggage. Prices surge during peak hours or bad weather. Expect to pay $15-40+ for intra-Manhattan rides, and $50-100+ for airport transfers.
ride_sharing.recommendation: Use as a supplement to public transit for convenience when needed, rather than primary mode of transport to manage budget.

taxi_services.options: Yellow Cabs (Manhattan and surrounding areas), Green Cabs (outer boroughs)
taxi_services.notes: Metered fares, widely available, especially in Manhattan. Similar pricing to ride-sharing services, sometimes less prone to surge pricing. Airport flat rates exist for Yellow Cabs to/from JFK.
taxi_services.recommendation: Good alternative to ride-sharing, especially for street hails.

airport_transfers.JFK: AirTrain to Jamaica Station (LIRR or Subway) or Howard Beach (Subway A train); Taxis/Ride-shares (flat fare for taxis to Manhattan)
airport_transfers.LGA: MTA Q70 LaGuardia Link Bus to Subway (7, E, F, M, R trains) or LIRR; Taxis/Ride-shares
airport_transfers.EWR: AirTrain to Newark Liberty International Airport Station (NJ Transit trains to Penn Station NYC or PATH train to World Trade Center/33rd Street); Taxis/Ride-shares

accommodation.description: Perfect for adventure seekers, Hotel 50 Bowery is nestled in the vibrant Lower East Side/Chinatown, offering an ideal base to explore unique neighborhoods, street art, and diverse culinary scenes. Enjoy stunning city views from The Crown rooftop bar and easy access to iconic landmarks like the Brooklyn Bridge, Manhattan Bridge, and historic downtown sites. Its modern design and energetic atmosphere perfectly complement an adventurous New York City experience, with direct subway access to explore all boroughs.

attractions.bestTime: Late afternoon for sunset views, reservations essential

attractions.name: Brooklyn Bridge Walk/Bike & DUMBO Exploration
attractions.bestTime: Early morning to avoid crowds, or late afternoon for golden hour

attractions.name: Governors Island Adventure
attractions.cost: Ferry $4 (free weekends before noon), activities extra (bike rental, climbing wall)
attractions.bestTime: Spring through Fall, weekends for more events

attractions.name: Day Trip to Hudson Valley (e.g., Breakneck Ridge Hike or Storm King Art Center)
attractions.cost: Train fare ~$30-$40 round trip, park entry often free or minimal
attractions.bestTime: Spring or Fall for comfortable hiking, clear weather

attractions.name: Trapeze School New York (Pier 40)
attractions.bestTime: Anytime classes are offered, reservations essential

attractions.name: NYC Helicopter Tour
attractions.bestTime: Clear weather, daytime for best visibility or sunset (if offered)

mustTry: Spicy Cumin Lamb Hand-Ripped Noodles (Biang Biang Noodles)

mustTry: Cheese Corn (part of the grill setup)

restaurants.name: Roberta's Pizza

restaurants.name: Los Tacos No. 1
restaurants.specialty: Authentic Baja-style Street Tacos and Quesadillas

activities.morning: Arrive at NYC airport (JFK/LGA/EWR), transfer to accommodation in Manhattan, check-in, and settle in. Take some time to relax after your journey.
activities.afternoon: Head to Midtown Manhattan. Start with a brief exploration of Times Square (the lights are impressive even during the day). Walk towards Bryant Park and visit the iconic New York Public Library (main branch). Have a casual lunch nearby.
activities.evening: Late afternoon reserved for **SUMMIT One Vanderbilt** (reservations essential for sunset views, approximately 2-3 hours). Enjoy the immersive experience and panoramic cityscapes as the sun sets. For dinner, head to a convenient **Los Tacos No. 1** location (e.g., Times Square or nearby Chelsea Market) for authentic Baja-style street tacos.

activities.morning: Start early with a **Brooklyn Bridge Walk & DUMBO Exploration**. Take the subway to City Hall station, walk across the Brooklyn Bridge (1-1.5 hours) enjoying the skyline views. Once in Brooklyn, explore the DUMBO neighborhood, visit Brooklyn Bridge Park, and grab coffee/pastries.
activities.afternoon: From DUMBO, take the NYC Ferry to Wall Street/Pier 11. Explore the Financial District, seeing the Charging Bull, Wall Street, and Trinity Church. Visit the 9/11 Memorial & Museum (allow 2-3 hours, consider booking tickets in advance).
activities.evening: Walk or take the subway to the Lower East Side. Enjoy a classic NYC dinner experience at **Katz's Delicatessen**. Indulge in their legendary pastrami on rye sandwich. Afterwards, explore the vibrant nightlife or unique shops of the Lower East Side or East Village.

activities.morning: Embark on an adventurous morning at **Trapeze School New York (Pier 40)**. Attend a beginner's class (allow 2-3 hours, reservations essential) and learn to fly on the trapeze with incredible views of the Hudson River.
activities.afternoon: Have lunch in the West Village or Chelsea. Afterwards, head to the Hudson River Park for an outdoor water activity. Enjoy **Kayaking/Paddleboarding on the Hudson River** (e.g., Downtown Boathouse offers free kayaking at Pier 26 or Pier 84 in summer; allow 1-2 hours). *Note: This activity is seasonal, typically summer months.*
activities.evening: Stroll along The High Line elevated park, enjoying the urban landscapes and art installations. Make your way to Chelsea Market. For dinner, enjoy more delicious tacos at **Los Tacos No. 1** located inside Chelsea Market. Explore the market's unique vendors and shops.

activities.morning: Take an early ferry from Battery Park/Lower Manhattan to **Governors Island Adventure**. Spend the morning exploring the island's unique landscapes, historic sites, art installations, and enjoying panoramic views of the Manhattan skyline and the Statue of Liberty. Consider renting bikes or trying the slides at The Hills. (Ferry is $4, often free weekends before noon.)
activities.afternoon: Continue your exploration of Governors Island, perhaps enjoying lunch from one of the island's food vendors. Return to Manhattan via ferry, then take the subway to Bushwick, Brooklyn.
activities.evening: Experience the hip vibe of Bushwick with dinner at **Roberta's Pizza**, famous for its wood-fired artisanal pizzas. After dinner, wander through the streets of Bushwick to admire the incredible street art and murals.

activities.morning: Embark on a **Day Trip to Hudson Valley**. Take an early morning Metro-North train from Grand Central Terminal. Options include: a challenging hike at Breakneck Ridge (check train schedule for direct access), or visiting the renowned outdoor sculpture park, Storm King Art Center (take a taxi from Beacon station). Enjoy the scenic journey and the natural beauty outside the city. Pack water and snacks. *Note: Spring or Fall are ideal for comfortable hiking and clear weather.*
activities.afternoon: Continue exploring your chosen Hudson Valley destination. If hiking Breakneck Ridge, complete your descent. If at Storm King, immerse yourself in the vast collection of modern and contemporary outdoor sculptures. Have lunch at a local spot in Beacon or pack a picnic.
activities.evening: Take the Metro-North train back to Grand Central. After a full day of outdoor adventure, enjoy a quick, flavorful, and casual dinner at **Xi'an Famous Foods** (multiple locations in Manhattan) for their spicy hand-ripped noodles and lamb dishes.

activities.morning: Experience NYC from above with an **NYC Helicopter Tour** (reservations essential, check weather conditions). This thrilling 15-20 minute flight provides unparalleled views of Manhattan, Brooklyn, and the Statue of Liberty (allow 1-2 hours total for check-in and transfer).
activities.afternoon: After your aerial adventure, immerse yourself in culture. Visit a world-class museum like the Metropolitan Museum of Art (MET) or the Museum of Modern Art (MoMA). Alternatively, spend the afternoon exploring Central Park, renting a rowboat, or simply people-watching.
activities.evening: For a lively and delicious dinner, head to Koreatown (K-Town) in Midtown West and indulge in premium Korean BBQ at **Kang Ho Dong Baekjeong**. Enjoy the interactive experience of grilling meats at your table, followed by exploring the vibrant K-Town area.

activities.morning: Enjoy a relaxed last morning in NYC. Have brunch at a cozy cafe in a neighborhood you enjoyed. Do some last-minute souvenir shopping or revisit a favorite spot for a final glimpse.
activities.afternoon: Depending on your flight schedule, explore a neighborhood you haven't had much time in, like Greenwich Village or SoHo. Enjoy a final New York lunch.
activities.evening: Check out from your accommodation and transfer to the airport for your departure, taking with you unforgettable memories of New York City.

localTips: Master the Subway: Purchase a MetroCard for seamless travel. Learn the difference between local and express lines; it's often the fastest way to navigate the city, but always check for service changes, especially on weekends.

Walk, Walk, Walk (with good shoes!): New York is a walking city. Wear incredibly comfortable shoes, as you'll cover miles exploring. Walking is often faster than taxis in traffic and lets you discover hidden gems.

Tipping is Expected: Standard tipping for services like restaurants, taxis, and haircuts is 15-20%. For quick coffee or counter service, a dollar or two in the tip jar is appreciated if service was good.
Be Street Smart: Always be aware of your surroundings, especially in crowded areas or late at night. Keep valuables secure and out of sight. While generally safe, petty theft can occur.

Early Birds Get the Worm (and fewer crowds): For popular attractions like museums, observation decks, or the Brooklyn Bridge, aim to visit right at opening time or late in the afternoon/evening to avoid peak crowds.

Utilize Free Views: Skip expensive boat tours for Statue of Liberty views by taking the free Staten Island Ferry. For skyline panoramas, many rooftop bars offer stunning vistas without an entry fee (just buy a drink).

The 'Bodega' is Your Friend: These ubiquitous corner stores are perfect for quick snacks, drinks, toiletries, and often surprisingly good coffee or sandwiches. They're a New Yorker's go-to for convenience.
Mind the Pedestrian Flow: New Yorkers walk fast. Stay to the right on sidewalks and escalators, and avoid stopping abruptly in the middle of a busy path to check your phone or map.
